meanings.definition: To support or hold up with or as if with a shore or shores.
meanings.sent1: The workers shored up the building to prevent it from collapsing.
meanings.sent2: He shored the fence with strong wooden beams.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel shored up its nest with twigs and leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her determination shored her up during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The friendship shored her up like a sturdy pillar of strength.

meanings.definition: To set or push (a boat) off from shore.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen shored the boat into the calm waters.
meanings.sent2: She shored the canoe gently into the lake.
meanings.sent3: The pirates shored the ship quickly to escape the storm.
meanings.sent4: He shored the sailboat away from the crowded dock.
meanings.sent5: Shoring the boat, they set off on their fishing adventure.

meanings.definition: To prop up or make level with a shore.
meanings.sent1: They shored the table to stop it from wobbling.
meanings.sent2: She shored the bookshelf with extra books to keep it steady.
meanings.sent3: The students shored their project with colorful illustrations.
meanings.sent4: He shored the painting against the wall for display.
meanings.sent5: Shoring the chair, she made sure it was safe to sit on.
